speaker: HERO
text: Good Ursula, wake my cousin Beatrice and

speaker: HERO
text: desire her to rise.

speaker: URSULA
text: I will, lady.

speaker: HERO
text: And bid her come hither.

speaker: URSULA
text: Well.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Troth, I think your other rebato were

speaker: MARGARET
text: better.

speaker: HERO
text: No, pray thee, good Meg, I’ll wear this.

speaker: MARGARET
text: By my troth, ’s not so good, and I warrant

speaker: MARGARET
text: your cousin will say so.

speaker: HERO
text: My cousin’s a fool, and thou art another. I’ll

speaker: HERO
text: wear none but this.

speaker: MARGARET
text: I like the new tire within excellently, if the

speaker: MARGARET
text: hair were a thought browner; and your gown’s a

speaker: MARGARET
text: most rare fashion, i’ faith. I saw the Duchess of

speaker: MARGARET
text: Milan’s gown that they praise so.

speaker: HERO
text: O, that exceeds, they say.

speaker: MARGARET
text: By my troth, ’s but a nightgown in respect

speaker: MARGARET
text: of yours—cloth o’ gold, and cuts, and laced with

speaker: MARGARET
text: silver, set with pearls, down sleeves, side sleeves,

speaker: MARGARET
text: and skirts round underborne with a bluish tinsel.

speaker: MARGARET
text: But for a fine, quaint, graceful, and excellent fashion,

speaker: MARGARET
text: yours is worth ten on ’t.

speaker: HERO
text: God give me joy to wear it, for my heart is

speaker: HERO
text: exceeding heavy.

speaker: MARGARET
text: ’Twill be heavier soon by the weight of a

speaker: MARGARET
text: man.

speaker: HERO
text: Fie upon thee! Art not ashamed?

speaker: MARGARET
text: Of what, lady? Of speaking honorably? Is

speaker: MARGARET
text: not marriage honorable in a beggar? Is not your

speaker: MARGARET
text: lord honorable without marriage? I think you

speaker: MARGARET
text: would have me say “Saving your reverence, a husband.”

speaker: MARGARET
text: An bad thinking do not wrest true speaking,

speaker: MARGARET
text: I’ll offend nobody. Is there any harm in “the heavier

speaker: MARGARET
text: for a husband”? None, I think, an it be the right

speaker: MARGARET
text: husband and the right wife. Otherwise, ’tis light and

speaker: MARGARET
text: not heavy. Ask my lady Beatrice else. Here she

speaker: MARGARET
text: comes.

speaker: HERO
text: Good morrow, coz.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Good morrow, sweet Hero.

speaker: HERO
text: Why, how now? Do you speak in the sick tune?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I am out of all other tune, methinks.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Clap ’s into “Light o’ love.” That goes

speaker: MARGARET
text: without a burden. Do you sing it, and I’ll dance it.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: You light o’ love with your heels! Then, if

speaker: BEATRICE
text: your husband have stables enough, you’ll see he

speaker: BEATRICE
text: shall lack no barns.

speaker: MARGARET
text: O, illegitimate construction! I scorn that

speaker: MARGARET
text: with my heels.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: ’Tis almost five o’clock, cousin. ’Tis time

speaker: BEATRICE
text: you were ready. By my troth, I am exceeding ill.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Heigh-ho!

speaker: MARGARET
text: For a hawk, a horse, or a husband?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: For the letter that begins them all, H.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Well, an you be not turned Turk, there’s no

speaker: MARGARET
text: more sailing by the star.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: What means the fool, trow?

speaker: MARGARET
text: Nothing, I; but God send everyone their

speaker: MARGARET
text: heart’s desire.

speaker: HERO
text: These gloves the Count sent me, they are an

speaker: HERO
text: excellent perfume.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: I am stuffed, cousin. I cannot smell.

speaker: MARGARET
text: A maid, and stuffed! There’s goodly catching

speaker: MARGARET
text: of cold.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: O, God help me, God help me! How long

speaker: BEATRICE
text: have you professed apprehension?

speaker: MARGARET
text: Ever since you left it. Doth not my wit

speaker: MARGARET
text: become me rarely?

speaker: BEATRICE
text: It is not seen enough; you should wear it in

speaker: BEATRICE
text: your cap. By my troth, I am sick.

speaker: MARGARET
text: Get you some of this distilled carduus benedictus

speaker: MARGARET
text: and lay it to your heart. It is the only thing for

speaker: MARGARET
text: a qualm.

speaker: HERO
text: There thou prick’st her with a thistle.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: Benedictus! Why benedictus? You have some

speaker: BEATRICE
text: moral in this benedictus?

speaker: MARGARET
text: Moral? No, by my troth, I have no moral

speaker: MARGARET
text: meaning; I meant plain holy thistle. You may think

speaker: MARGARET
text: perchance that I think you are in love. Nay, by ’r

speaker: MARGARET
text: Lady, I am not such a fool to think what I list, nor I

speaker: MARGARET
text: list not to think what I can, nor indeed I cannot

speaker: MARGARET
text: think, if I would think my heart out of thinking, that

speaker: MARGARET
text: you are in love or that you will be in love or that you

speaker: MARGARET
text: can be in love. Yet Benedick was such another, and

speaker: MARGARET
text: now is he become a man. He swore he would never

speaker: MARGARET
text: marry, and yet now, in despite of his heart, he eats

speaker: MARGARET
text: his meat without grudging. And how you may be

speaker: MARGARET
text: converted I know not, but methinks you look with

speaker: MARGARET
text: your eyes as other women do.

speaker: BEATRICE
text: What pace is this that thy tongue keeps?

speaker: MARGARET
text: Not a false gallop.

speaker: URSULA
text: Madam, withdraw. The Prince, the Count,

speaker: URSULA
text: Signior Benedick, Don John, and all the gallants of

speaker: URSULA
text: the town are come to fetch you to church.

speaker: HERO
text: Help to dress me, good coz, good Meg, good

speaker: HERO
text: Ursula.
